DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether anorectal application of Nasha Dx is safe and effective for treatment of anal incontinence.
DOC.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Anorectal Application of Dx-gel for Treatment of Anal Incontinence
DOC.detailed_description: Patients not fully improved after 1:st injection were offered reinjection after 4-6 weeks.
DOC.criteria: Incontinence to loose or solid stool at least once weekly (Millers incontinence score 612). Age 1880 Available for followup for the duration of the study Written informed consent. Sphincter defect visible on anal ultrasound. Pregnancy. Rectal prolapse or inflammatory bowel disease. Recent (within 6 months) anal surgery except for haemorrhoids. Anorectal sepsis. Anticoagulant medication or bleeding diathesis.
